bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 163, Number 106 (Wednesday, June 21, 2017)][Pages H5048-H5049]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. ROS-LEHTINEN:H.R. 2976.[[Page H5049]]Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1 Section 8 of the Constitution of the UnitedStates of America

item.latestTitle: Department of Defense and Labor, Health and Human Services, and Education Appropriations Act, 2019 and Continuing Appropriations Act, 2019
Deferment for Active Cancer Treatment Act of 2018

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

item.latestTitle: Departments of Labor, Health and Human Services, and Education, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2019

latestAction.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 667.

item.latestTitle: College Loan Deferment for Recovery Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

Deferment for Active Cancer Treatment Act of 2017

This bill amends title IV (Student Assistance) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 to allow borrowers to defer student loans while they are receiving cancer treatment and during the six months after treatment.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: Deferment for Active Cancer Treatment Act of 2017

item.title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to allow for the deferment of certain student loans during a period in which a borrower is receiving treatment for cancer.
Deferment for Active Cancer Treatment Act of 2017
Deferment for Active Cancer Treatment Act of 2017

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
